column10: I enjoy how healthy a community it is, people are willing to help all the time and are super supportive with new users. I have just started this game and am i happy with how much content is waiting for me
This isn’t a great game but isn’t a bad one either. It has a unique charm to it, but that charm wears off faster than you can count to 10.
good game

As a casual gamer, this game has so many of the things I look forward to in my limited time:

Regional events that are happening all the time, with reward cooldowns that support not being able to play for hours every day.

A combat system that feels smooth and intuitive. Complex enough to be engaging, but straightforward enough that I can plug in an play without feeling completely overwhelmed, even after months away.

Very little gating of content. Even crafting allows players to participate in all available professions. No need to select and forego.

The quests are voice acted well, and the quests are easy to do in small increments while still maintaining a feeling of forward progression.

And with all of that, the game is really pretty, too! It's a downright really fun time, and something I really look forward to in those rare moments when I have time to sit down a play a game.
love it  my kind of game

I very much enjoy the slow combat and world building this game does it feels fresh and fun thought a few things need worked on.

The female character creation choices are VERY lacking like they need improvement.
Some vouchers don't work for some reason aka the character appearance voucher but really other than that i cant find anything wrong with the game so far.

Ill obviously come back to reedit this if i do.
game sucks nothing else to say

Keep in mind this is a free to play game!\
Story OK, not gripping like FFXIV or SWTOR
Graphics are good, better than most but I'd put it below BDO
Gameplay is good; combat has weight, there's combos and dodging. Nice pace to it, not too fast. There's matchmaking for group activities. Crafting/fishing is pretty easy to get into and world bosses are pretty fun. Not really any P2W things tbh. PVP is pretty fun as well. The questing system is kinda like GW2
Sound is meh; SFX are ok but the BGM is pretty average
Overall game is good but lacks polish; NPCs kinda just stand around, not much voice acting, time/weather changes are pretty jarring.

The core game play of the game is great. Don't let people tell you PvP is end game either. There is a bit to do once you hit mid-game, although, it will get repetitive after awhile. The game has a lot of room to grow ... The Dev team can be frustrating though.

been playing for over 300 hours spent 3000 dollers on the game to get all the itams i need to que for dungons now the game is stuck and it wont let me que to dungons anymore and this issue is still not fixed been hours now i really love  the game so i hope you guys fix this soon ! the devs are on something for sure

I prefer a game with multiple paths to level, maybe i'm anti-social but I do not play in guilds or parties and I hate quests to do something in an arena that requires another player to progress.  there should be multiple paths to level not a single route. I used the my mount to get the explorer title before I was 20th level and did enjoy touring the uninhabited (currently with few players in them during launch) parts of the world.  Later  I revisited all of the teleport waypoints to find and open chests to gain more bag storage.  it would be nice to know how much space items each used to determine what to save and what has to go. All in all though I did enjoy some things the game did not feel right overall, The abilities of your toon  were not as useful as that weapon you bought with the daily starseed trades.  Do boss monsters scale with the number of players at all?

well after playing a while now i can say this game is not worth it pc support is horrible and they put random npcs in game if you dont really read everything they can destroy items and repeat things over and over after level 30 your pretty much lost after finishing the main quest all in all not worth playing other games seems better with no traps/tricks in game to make you waste weeks of your time
Like
Its good for a free game

Was fun at first but then the problems started to emerge...

1, The loot that drops are worse than terrible... not sure how they expect you to improve your Gear Score when all the high level mobs (world bosses) and dungeons your level drop items far worse than what you are already wearing? makes no sense...
Maybe a ploy to get you pay real money to buy the currency to buy the gear from the in-game player traders?
2, Trade post is terrible... so many menus to navigate through just to be able to sell/buy an item, and no player-player trading... all trade done through trade post, in an mmo !
3, most of the top level mobs constantly have an AOE effect around them, making melee classes (Berzerker/Crusader) at a huge disadvantage when fighting them, as getting close to do actual damage is virtual suicide.
4, Sadly over the past few weeks iv'e seen fewer and fewer people playing (EU Server), the main hub areas that were bristling with people just weeks ago are now ghost places harbouring a few die-hards and goldsellers. I can't advise spending your time in the game when the numbers are so low and falling daily...

But for me it was the lack of loot that was the final nail in the coffin... to progress needing (Star seeds) to buy stupidly expensive items in the player auction house as all you get it trash.
Can play fast or slow at your own pace. Great graphics and play style.

1.) Make an UI setting where you can see your characters name besides pressing "o" to see, makes it easier for everyone and this is a big thing for MMORPG how you guys ignored this I don't know why

2.) Camera gets locked when you accidently press or the enemy is too far away and you press lock on and your camera literally have a seizure and ruins game play. It's really not fun and annoying and I have died in dungeon when this did happen.

3.) When someone VOTES TO END dungeon hooo this is sooo frustrating your CHARACTER cant attack, roll, NOTHING UNLESS you press agree or disagree.. GET RID OF THAT. Sure we need vote to end dungeon but it shouldn't STOP MY CHARACTER TO PLAY. I've lost SEVERAL dungeons thanks to this vote mandatory you guys imp laced. PLEASE, for the love of god I love doing dungeons but THIS RUINS THE DUNGEON GAMEPLAY.

4.) If you take the time to play ranger like I have the skill "Tempest volley" doesn't WORK. Yes, you heard it right, try playing the ranger and keep pressing the button sometimes LITERALLY sometimes it holds and DISABLES on its OWN. Please get that bug fixed ASAP, really frustrating while PVPING!|

5.) Implant more Movement speed elixirs. You got literally every elixir in the game but movement speed. You got HP, Defense, Dmg, Crit, Crit dmg, Defense decrease and dmg increase but no MOVEMENT SPEED!. The only MOVEMENT SPEED we have is from the Blessing in towns and THAT GETS DISABLED IN DUNGEONS!!. If no to movement speed elixirs then decrease the stamina consumed when rolling and etc. You are minimized to moving in this game which is fine that's why Elixir of movement speed would be amazing.

6.) When ANYONE is above you in the stairs lets say for example.. My ARROWS cannot hit them because they're above me? Such as thundering arrow?? This is the FIRST, FIRST EVER MMORPG where I can't hit someone because of the SLOPE? Like WHAT? PLEASE HAHA THIS IS SO STUPID IDK HOW ITS IN THE GAME BUT FIX THAT. PLEASE LMAO

7.) Female cosmetics are really bad. You guys need to implant more cosmetics that worth getting and COSMETICS WHERE YOU CAN DYE?? HOW COME YOU CAN DYE REGULAR AMORS WITH NO OUTFITS BUT THE OUTFITS I BUY WITH REAL LIFE MONEY I CANT DYE??????????? WHAT THE HECK IS UP WITH THAT?????????? MAKE YOUR COSMETICS DYABLE AND MORE COSMETICS PLEASE AND THANKS. REALLY FEEL LIKE IM POOR WHILE SPENDING MONEY FOR A GAME LIKE LMFAO.


Other than that the game is meh. litearlly meh, Im coping for Lost ARK. I need something to play and I gotta play with this no cap, Dying fellas.. Dying. New world disappointed me with "delays". Past 2 years have been utter sht for gaming community. Im dying fellas.. Dying..

*This game is one of those that you either love or hate (look at the trends). 
  *It seems most players did not really spend time to try and figure out their class and how the abilities work together. If you are the type of person who wants to jump right into a game an be the hero / meta lord day 1...well you probably aren't gonna like this game (there are really no accurate guides OR DPS meters to ruin your experience).
  *From my experience I don't think that this game is one of those that you blitz through and it becomes another check box in your completed Steam Library. Spend some time with the game it is an MMORPG and by that nature it takes time for your character to develop.
  *This is also something different from most other MMO's online. You will either enjoy it or after playing pass on it but its worth a fair go and judge it for yourself.

I performed a recharge operation on the recharge page set in the game. The cumulative recharge value is more than RMB 25,000. All consumption records can be viewed in Steam, and there is no refund record. However, the official slandered me for payment fraud, restricted login to my account, and violated my personal property and reputation.

decent world to explore, plenty of side quests, decent combat, nice to see tons of people fighting world bosses. only downside for me is priests are not healing and the aggro system is weird. cant p2w as much as people say, just small % increase which you can get in game and dont even need tbh. open world pvp.. 30+ hours and no open word pvp yet lol. even if you die, you basically lose nothing and it takes 2 seconds to get back to what you were doing. let me get another 70 hours to change this and say the games trash. also, limited customization but can be funny... my little brother has the small race with the smallest height and is all green lmao.

Edit:
Had fun untill level 31+ , Now left the game as it s pointless game, got my founder package, but hoping major changes under mentioned areas.

Lumen (Premium currency
Is a joke. If you think, alright, i will spend 5€ on that free to play game, to increase my storage capacity (which is intended as you have super limited storage, most things stack on low amounts like 20 or 100, when item crafting will require like 400)..

1 SINGLE backpack slot costs 3 Euros. it has to be a typo it should be 3 pesos.
As you also have account storage and warehouse storage and they are even more expensive.

MARKETPLACE:
Game currency is a joke.
Basically devs are fighting against Star seed sellers(actual currency you can use to buy things).
Without founders pack etc.. i maybe have earned around 50k star seed in that time. (you can transfer gold into star seeds N times, depending on your level)
So trading economy is bollocks.. legendary gear sells for 1.5m il star seed and more, so only if YOU BUY star seeds from sellers, you can obtain those items or spend grinding days for that luck.

END GAME:
Basically, almost no one PvP-s, as there is no point in that (Need to have super active guild who helps to farm also PvP gear, as gears have single stat, which basically means if it s PvE or PvP gear.).
All end game is basically grinding the same dungeons or world bosses
NB: Monsters Scale! therefore no matter how much you spend your time on gear grinding, AI will dynamically increase in level and HP. Turning it into useless.

Dungeon AI will keep the same level scale, so that s nice.. Open world is useless as a sock inside a sandal.

Just not my favorite play style.  With all combat based on attack combinations, you find yourself walking through the same combinations over and over again, against every mob, rather than using individual skills against different types of opponents or as required by different situations.  I guess if what you want to do is program a couple of key macros to auto execute the attack combinations, then you'll be able to pretty much sleep your way through this game.  I wish them luck.  Just not sure that I'll be along for the ride.

I don't know anything about the previous Bless releases. I do know this is F2P downloadable MMO ... so I downloaded it ... played it, and wrapping up for the day at level 12. And I had FUN.

Is this a genre changing MMO? No it is not. Is this a game you should avoid? No. It is not.

I have not been a fan of tab targeting for oh ... going on about 7 years. The action combat here is decent.
You can briskly move through the primary quest chains, or meander through LOTS of side quests.

Is there a cash shop? There sure is. Do you need to buy items from the cash shop, to progress? No. Plenty of gear drops, and mini co-op events with even more drops. Costumes in the cash shop are cosmetic only, no buffs.

End game in any MMO is a slog. I still don't understand peoples rush to max out as quickly as possible. I'm in no hurry, and so far enjoying the journey.

Bottom line, Bless unleashed is worth your attention, if you are looking for something new, and just different enough from the long in the tooth standard fare that has been around for years.

Bless Unleashed is super fun alone and with friends. The world boss fights challenging and reward win you beat them.

So I decided to ignore a lot of the negatively surrounding this game and happy that I did. I even took the leap on buying the ultimate founders pack as well before launch and do not regret it. Has been worth it investing some time in so far compared to starting fresh in older MMOs.

To start this review off, I paid for the 150$ pack of the original Bless Online. Yes they burned me and Yes i was angry. However, with New World Delay and boredom of FFXIV, Bless it is.

This game is not a 10/10 best new MMO. But its fun enough to keep me interested. It is a MASSIVE improvement in the technical department over the last Bless. my FPS stay pretty solid and can actually play the game in high traffic areas. The combat starts off slow and clunky but turns into something that is actually pretty cool(but still a bit clunky) I have no idea of any sort of story as i have skipped all cut scenes. Most of these Korean MMO's stories are not good anyways.  The game shows its age usually with weird model shading but i am sometimes surprised by little details like real time reflections on metallic surfaces (Armor/Weapons etc). I do feel some of the balance scaling is weird. Field bosses one shot people even 4 or 5 levels above them which seems strange. I feel like i take a ton of damage from sources that i dont notice till i'm very low. So, little quirks here and there. 

35 hours in im at about a 6.5/10. Nothing to write home about but it will hold till New World.

I played this game quite a bit on PS4/5 - Was a lot of fun. This game is the exact same game from the consoles, but made for PC. Sounds good! Not "next-gen" as claimed, but fun.

I was able to play for about 9 minutes the first time, to which I was met with no English on the NA Server at all; So be it, this game isn't much for PUGging anyway. Then minute 10 came with a crash. The recommendation is to disable overlays. Tried - More crashes. I am unable to play for more than 5 minutes without a crash - And by 'crash' I just mean the game stalling, esp in cutscenes, and 'Not Responding' to Windows. The Disc/Forums/Reddit is filled with people with this issue, but I haven't seen any replies.

I asked how to submit a ticket, but no reply - Official support is "via Discord", despite having a ticket system in game. Any attempt to use the console Bless (Actually maintained) is met with "This is a different studio, please go to their webpage".

I enjoy this game, it's a fun, casual, RPG. However, this studio is not earning any of my recommendations in the current state. 

As of day 2 the Global chat is also filled with gold spammers non-stop. Easily 100-200 messages a minute.

So Far not bad, lets see how it plays out.

After level 30 its forced PvP only. There is a toggle where YOU can't PvP, except others can still PvP you. Except you can pay 2 dollars an hour to have PvP be off...paying...to...have...no...PvP...HAHAHAHA!

And yes I play BDO which has PvP forced to be on. Except there is no cash shop item to remove PvP and the death for PvP is annoyance, nothing serious. The world is massive (zones in this game are crowded and small) so PvP is extremely rare to begin with. 

Never played a game where you pay real money per hour to have no PvP.

Fun game to pass the time with, will definitely put a decent amount of hours in. After putting more hours in, I can say this release is far and away better than the original Bless Online release a couple years ago. The game as it sits now is a fun action-mmo that is not as fast paced as BDO, but feels better than blade and soul or tera. I can see myself putting atleast 100 hours into this game and probably more as time goes on. Will it become my go to MMO, most likely not, but it is a fun game that scratches the itch for now and it is f2p, so I really can't ask for more. Would recommend a go if you are an avid MMO player and want something new to play while waiting for other games to come out.

A much better game than before.

SO Much Better than I ever imagined!  The fighting actually gets enjoyably-challenging against elites and area bosses and dungeon-mobs by the time you get to level 14/15...  until then is kind of meditative with some fresh dynamics for MMORPG that are welcoming.   Had to use mouse, number buttons, movement buttons, and screen-flashing keyboard keys in sequence to defeat most reset quest elite (in tight area): THAT was an exhilarating fighting (I was taken down twice before getting it done well).
DONT LISTEN TO THE REVIEW BOMBERS! its a solid game.. give it a try and see what you think!
It's better than it ever has been. Successful filler while waiting for NW/AOC. I have noticed that most of the negative reviews are less than a couple hours played time.

Being review bombed from people angry about previous releases.  Not reflective of this release... it's no more P2W than BDO, and the combat is relatively engaging though may get repetitive.  For a free to play with some 'premium' perks you pay for, it's not bad at all.  Recommend you give it a shot and ignore anyone simply saying "game is trash!! lulz", they're trolling.
